text:
I noticed about new client sdk (node.js) via 
> Merge pull request #1187 from angrbrd/client_sdk 
Looks like current implementation is for member services, but I also see some code related to chaincode Invoke/Query.  I suspect this module might include most of peer rest api in the near future. Is this correct ? Not sure if Angry Bird monitor this channel or not.  I also think we should remove Bluemix things (or make it Cloud Foundry and Docker aware module as cloud native app.

text: start by reading it and then ask specific questions

<@U0Z3BE0F5>: I have been following the steps given, to setup the Swagger-UI. I ran into a error message "exit status 2
FAIL", when running go test -v -run TestServerOpenchain_API_GetBlockCount,

I am accessing the peer in browser using - 127.0.0.1:5000. Can I use only this address to explore the apis or should I stick with swagger-ui or nodejs application(I have zero knowledge in both of them)
I cannot help you with the Swagger-UI because I couldn't set it up either
nodejs has a library which can be used
<https://github.com/IBM-Blockchain/ibm-blockchain-js>

attachments.title: IBM-Blockchain/ibm-blockchain-js
attachments.text: Contribute to ibm-blockchain-js development by creating an account on GitHub.

text: but the problem is that I think it is not being updated with the hyperledger project
What about this address 127.0.0.1:5000?
what are you doing with it?
I thought of interfacing the fabric with a simple html page by making a ajax call to this address
My concern is that whether this a correct way of communicating with the fabric?
I am not fully certain but I think that in this case you might want to use the REST API
POST host:port/chaincode for instance
being host the address of you VP and port is usually by default 5000
This is a ajax call right. Can you give a example of this POST request?
look for REST Endpoints in the link you posted
OK , for example for the invole function - /devops/deploy needs to be used. could you give me an example like:- $.ajax({url: <http://127.0.01:5000/devops/deploy/>, data:data, type:POST}).
I am sorry I can't help you further (not sure)
but beware that devops/deploy is deprecated
ok, thanks for your help

<@U0S5KF44D>: sorry, was on the phone
my primary question is: is it usable as checked in to the HL repo?  I tried it but got an exception from simply the require(‘hlc’)
i suspect I am just not using it properly (I am not a nodejs guy)
but I was curious if it was expected to work (at least to the level that test.js calls it) or is it just there as a preview
i think part of the problem is that its not in npmjs yet, so I am not sure if I declared the dep properly in the package.json
it seems transitive deps like grpc were not being found so the require blows up…like I said on the OBC slack, i suspect its 99% operator error on my part

<@U0KPFAZNF|ghaskins> uploaded a file: <https://hyperledgerproject.slack.com/files/ghaskins/F13FUD5UG/-.txt|Untitled> and commented: I was including it by path explicitly since its not in npmjs yet…I can see that npm-install does pull it locally into my node_modules but for some reason the transitives are not visible to the runtime

text: so my question is: how are you guys using this today?
Greg, try running “npm install .” from the sdk/node directory.  Or did you already do that?
I did that (I think, heh) but I can try again
the deps are there, i think part of the problem is they are nested
e.g. I see my-app/node_modules/hlc/node_modules/grpc
and when I require(‘hlc’) its blowing up b/c it doesnt see grpc
is this typically how it works (nested like that)?
apologies, im sure these are nodejs noob level questions

<!here|@here> -- A quick question re NVP's and world state. After reviewing the protocol spec in great depth, and visiting every reference to non-validating or state, I cannot find out whether the NVP maintains a copy of the world state in addition to its copy of the blockchain. The reason I ask is that it would be very useful to deploy an NVP whose sole job it to service complex state queries for lightweight analytical purposes. But if NVPs don't have world state, then their usefulness would drop quite a bit I think ... (still nice to have NVPs handle apps and events, but not nearly as useful of taking the queries out of the VPs in very active systems) ...
i don't think that we really use NVPs at the moment
we do
ah!
as application gateways
it will not be able to  maintain world state for confidential chaincode
it is my understanding that the NVP is a subset of the VP, so would it not have the confidentiality code as well?
but more importantly, since NVPs do not execute transaction, they would need to replicate world state from their connected VPs ...

also, re security, we envision NVPs living inside corporate firewalls in some instances and thus having implicit security ... perhaps it should be possible to configure such an NVP with a default security level ...
<@U0UKTPMG8> might also be able to chime in on NVP and state ?

<@U0KPFAZNF|ghaskins> uploaded a file: <https://hyperledgerproject.slack.com/files/ghaskins/F13GHLMPT/screen_shot_2016-04-25_at_12.47.19_pm.png|Screen Shot 2016-04-25 at 12.47.19 PM.png> and commented: <@U0S5KF44D>: “require(‘hlc’) from within electron UI…it might be a problem with electron’s ASAR interpretation of transitive deps

initial_comment.comment: <@U0S5KF44D>: “require(‘hlc’) from within electron UI…it might be a problem with electron’s ASAR interpretation of transitive deps

text: thanks <@U0ULK2JPP>

<@U11CP8FF1>: fyi, i notice a bug in the chaintool code generator today (<https://github.com/ghaskins/chaintool/commit/960696dbcbdea2df9aaa87c906936d1fee7e1406>), ill cut a v0.5.1 update to address this
<@U0XR6J961>: <@U0ULK2JPP> wrt to nvp, I believe the current thinking is that state is NOT replicated to nvps, only the blocks.  For now, I do not think even blocks are replicated as of yet.
right, that's what i thought
but you could as well
yes, the parts are in place to support it
and right, an operator may configure their NVP with encryption keys so that the NVP can also read confidential state

<@U0UKTPMG8>: thanks ... the protocol spec says that NVPs maintain a copy of the blockchain, but this is actually of less use than maintaining a copy of world state as application gateways would be tremendously useful for offloading state queries ... any chance that world state will eventually get copied to NVPs?
<@U0Y55KNG2>: the current issue is that state is interpreted relative to chaincode, and queries today go through chaincode themselves.

I don't think it is technically infeasible, but the form of the state values if chaincode dependent, ie. the state is simply bytes, and the reader of the state would need to have internal knowledge of the storage.
basically, wrt to any chance question, yes.  But I think we need to approach carefully wrt the privacy.

<@U0UKTPMG8>: I have been labouring under the impression that the protocol spec says that NVPs are a proper subset of VPs for a reason ... as in they run chaincode (after VPs validate of course) for queries (but not invokes) and they maintain world state as replicated copies ... but if they don't run chaincode and they don't maintain state then they are a rather small subset of a VP ...
i.e. I have been viewing NVPs as a VP without consensus rights
but that was clearly way off base
at least for the current implementation
but I do not think your are far from the target
wrt to your expectations
and the specs statements :simple_smile:
ah ... ok ... so I'm not hallucinating :simple_smile:
no, well.... not wrt to this :simple_smile:
I'll put in a disclaimer in my sample contract docs then ... "evolving blah blah blah" ...
thanks!
is the API for membership services documented anywhere ?
